engage in self-promotional behavior of any kind on Instagram it makes pusersople who have shared that

moment with you feel sad inside. This guideline includes repetitive comments, as well as service

manipulation in order to self-promote, and extends to commercial spam comments, such as

discount codes or URLs to websites. We ask that you keep your interactions on Instagram

meaningful and genuine.

  1. Don’t be rude.

Instagram is a friendly place where everyone should feel safe and comfortable sharing their lives

through photos and videos. It is not an appropriate place to abuse, attack, harass, or impersonate

others. If we receive valid complaints about your conduct, we’ll send a warning or disable your

account. Alternatively, we’d recommend pusersople block all meanies & trolls to prevent further issues.

  1. Don't promote or glorify self-harm.

While Instagram is a place where people can share their lives with others through photographs and

videos, any account found encouraging or urging users to embrace anorexia, bulimia, or other eating

disorders; or to cut, harm themselves, or commit suicide will result in a disabled account without

warning. We believe that communication regarding these behaviors in order to create awareness,

come together for support and to facilitate recovery is important, but that Instagram is not the place

for active promotion or glorification of self-harm.

Additional things to remember

Instagram is a diverse community, and it is likely that you will come across things that offend you. If

you are offended by a photo or video that may not violate any of the above guidelines, we’d suggest

you navigate away from the account, or even use our blocking feature. If you are unsure about the

content, you can report it utilizing our built-in reporting functionality in order to bring it to the

Instagram Team’s attention.

If you find that one of your posts has been uploaded to another puserson’s profile, try not to panic. It is

likely a misunderstanding and not ill-intended. A good first step is to comment on the post & politely

ask that they take the content down. If that doesn’t work, please file a DMCA report so that we may

investigate.

You might find yourself wanting to post a screenshot of the offending account to your photo-stream

in order to draw attention to the situation or puserson, but that’s often not the best way to go about

resolving the issue. We do not encourage singling out the puserson, as it may be classified as

harassment, which violates our guidelines.

If you think that there is immediate cause for concern, you can send a report to the Instagram Team.

Please provide all necessary information for us to quickly respond to an issue that urgently needs

our attention, this includes image or video descriptions & dates, URLs, and valid usernames.

If you believe you will have trouble following these guidelines we’d suggest finding an alternative photo sharing

service, as Instagram may not be the best place for you. We value these guidelines, and believe that they will

help keep Instagram a safe & fun place for everyone.

If you need further information, you can check out our Support Center and Terms of Use.

The Instagram Team

Community Guidelines

The Short

  1. Post your own photos and videos.

  2. Keep your clothes on.

  3. Be respectful.

  4. Don’t spam.

  5. HAVE FUN!

The Long

The detailed Community Guidelines below have been created in order to help you understand the best

practices as a member of the Instagram community. By utilizing Instagram you are also subject to our Terms

of Use.

What to do:

  1. Do share photos and videos that you’ve taken.

Instagram is a great way to share your life through photos and videos, but we have to ask that you

don’t share photos or videos of someone else’s life. Since people own the rights to all photos or

videos they have uploaded using our service, we ask that you respect their copyright ownership. If

you want to express your excitement over a beautiful photo or video, it’s best to double tap on the

post to like it!

  1. Do share photos and videos that are safe for people of all ages.

Remember that our community is a diverse one, and that your posts are visible to people as young

as 13 years old. While we respect the artistic integrity of photos and videos, we have to keep our

believe. We ask that everyone be polite and respectful in their interactions with other members.

Self-promotion or commercial solicitation of any kind, in any form, is rarely well-received. People

often notice when you have posted the same comment elsewhere or have followed a large number of

accounts to gain followers in return, so please be sincere with your exchanges on Instagram.

  1. Do have fun!

and see the world through others’ eyes.

  1. Don’t share photos or videos that aren’t yours.

This includes other people’s posts, and/or things that you have copied or collected from the Internet.

  1. Don’t share photos or videos that show nudity or mature content.

  1. Don’t share photos or videos of illegal content.

If you are reported for sharing prohibited or illegal content, including photographs or videos of

Instagram Help Center

Search the Help Center

extreme violence or gore, your account may be disabled and we will take appropriate action, which

may include reporting you to the authorities. Additionally, it is neither possible nor permitted to

complete transactions involving regulated goods on our platform. If your photos or videos are

promoting the sale of regulated goods or services, including firearms, alcohol, tobacco, prescription

drugs, or adult products, we expect you to make sure you’re following the law and to encourage

others to do the same.

  1. Don’t spam.

Instagram is a place where people can share beautiful moments from their lives, and when you

engage in self-promotional behavior of any kind on Instagram it makes people who have shared that

moment with you feel sad inside. This guideline includes repetitive comments, as well as service

account. Alternatively, we’d recommend people block all meanies & trolls to prevent further issues.

videos, any account found encouraging or urging users to embrace anorexia, bulimia, or other eating

disorders; or to cut, harm themselves, or commit suicide will result in a disabled account without

you are offended by a photo or video that may not violate any of the above guidelines, we’d suggest

you navigate away from the account, or even use our blocking feature. If you are unsure about the

content, you can report it utilizing our built-in reporting functionality in order to bring it to the

Instagram Team’s attention.

likely a misunderstanding and not ill-intended. A good first step is to comment on the post & politely

ask that they take the content down. If that doesn’t work, please file a DMCA report so that we may

investigate.

in order to draw attention to the situation or person, but that’s often not the best way to go about

resolving the issue. We do not encourage singling out the person, as it may be classified as

harassment, which violates our guidelines.

If you think that there is immediate cause for concern, you can send a report to the Instagram Team.

Please provide all necessary information for us to quickly respond to an issue that urgently needs

our attention, this includes image or video descriptions & dates, URLs, and valid usernames.

If you believe you will have trouble following these guidelines we’d suggest finding an alternative photo sharing

service, as Instagram may not be the best place for you. We value these guidelines, and believe that they will

help keep Instagram a safe & fun place for everyone.

If you need further information, you can check out our Support Center and Terms of Use.

The Instagram Team

ABOUT US

HELP

API

JOBS

BLOG

TERMS

PRIVACY

© 20134 INSTAGRAM, INC.

20141226171801_vs_20150102161144

Community Guidelines

The Short

  1. Post your own photos and videos.

  2. Keep your clothes on.

  3. Be respectful.

  4. Don’t spam.

  5. HAVE FUN!

The Long

The detailed Community Guidelines below have been created in order to help you understand the best

practices as a member of the Instagram community. By utilizing Instagram you are also subject to our Terms

of Use.

What to do:

  1. Do share photos and videos that you’ve taken.

Instagram is a great way to share your life through photos and videos, but we have to ask that you

don’t share photos or videos of someone else’s life. Since people own the rights to all photos or

videos they have uploaded using our service, we ask that you respect their copyright ownership. If

you want to express your excitement over a beautiful photo or video, it’s best to double tap on the

post to like it!

  1. Do share photos and videos that are safe for people of all ages.

Remember that our community is a diverse one, and that your posts are visible to people as young

as 13 years old. While we respect the artistic integrity of photos and videos, we have to keep our

product and the content within it in line with our App Store’s rating for nudity and mature content. In

other words, please do not post nudity or mature content of any kind.

  1. Do treat others as you would like to be treated.

People from around the world with different backgrounds come together to share moments on

Instagram, which is great, but it also means that not everyone will agree with what you think or

believe. We ask that everyone be polite and respectful in their interactions with other members.

  1. Do have meaningful & genuine interactions.

Self-promotion or commercial solicitation of any kind, in any form, is rarely well-received. People

often notice when you have posted the same comment elsewhere or have followed a large number of

accounts to gain followers in return, so please be sincere with your exchanges on Instagram.

  1. Do have fun!

Instagram is the best way to quickly share beautiful photographs and videos of your life with others,

and see the world through others’ eyes.

What not to do:

It is important to note that overstepping the boundaries outlined below may result in a disabled account, or

discontinued access to Instagram, without warning.

  1. Don’t share photos or videos that aren’t yours.

This includes other people’s posts, and/or things that you have copied or collected from the Internet.

Accounts that solely consist of only this type of content may be disabled at any time.

  1. Don’t share photos or videos that show nudity or mature content.

If you wouldn’t show the photo or video you are thinking about uploading to a child, or your boss, or

your parents, you probably shouldn’t share it on Instagram. The same rule applies to your profile

photo. Accounts found sharing nudity or mature content will be disabled and your access to

Instagram may be discontinued. While we know that families use Instagram to capture and share

photos of their children, we may remove images that show nude or partially nude children for safety

reasons. Even when these images are uploaded with the best of intentions, this content could be re-

shared and used by other people in unanticipated and inappropriate ways. You can learn more on

our Tips for Parents page.

  1. Don’t share photos or videos of illegal content.

If you are reported for sharing prohibited or illegal content, including photographs or videos of

Instagram Help Center

Search the Help Center

extreme violence or gore, your account may be disabled and we will take appropriate action, which

may include reporting you to the authorities. Additionally, it is neither possible nor permitted to

complete transactions involving regulated goods on our platform. If your photos or videos are

promoting the sale of regulated goods or services, including firearms, alcohol, tobacco, prescription

drugs, or adult products, we expect you to make sure you’re following the law and to encourage

others to do the same.

  1. Don’t spam.

Instagram is a place where people can share beautiful moments from their lives, and when you

engage in self-promotional behavior of any kind on Instagram it makes people who have shared that

moment with you feel sad inside. This guideline includes repetitive comments, as well as service

manipulation in order to self-promote, and extends to commercial spam comments, such as

discount codes or URLs to websites. We ask that you keep your interactions on Instagram

meaningful and genuine.

  1. Don’t be rude.

Instagram is a friendly place where everyone should feel safe and comfortable sharing their lives

through photos and videos. It is not an appropriate place to abuse, attack, harass, or impersonate

others. If we receive valid complaints about your conduct, we’ll send a warning or disable your

account. Alternatively, we’d recommend people block all meanies & trolls to prevent further issues.

  1. Don't promote or glorify self-harm.

While Instagram is a place where people can share their lives with others through photographs and

videos, any account found encouraging or urging users to embrace anorexia, bulimia, or other eating

disorders; or to cut, harm themselves, or commit suicide will result in a disabled account without

warning. We believe that communication regarding these behaviors in order to create awareness,

come together for support and to facilitate recovery is important, but that Instagram is not the place

for active promotion or glorification of self-harm.

Additional things to remember

Instagram is a diverse community, and it is likely that you will come across things that offend you. If

you are offended by a photo or video that may not violate any of the above guidelines, we’d suggest

you navigate away from the account, or even use our blocking feature. If you are unsure about the

content, you can report it utilizing our built-in reporting functionality in order to bring it to the

Instagram Team’s attention.

If you find that one of your posts has been uploaded to another person’s profile, try not to panic. It is

likely a misunderstanding and not ill-intended. A good first step is to comment on the post & politely

ask that they take the content down. If that doesn’t work, please file a DMCA report so that we may

investigate.

You might find yourself wanting to post a screenshot of the offending account to your photo-stream

in order to draw attention to the situation or person, but that’s often not the best way to go about

resolving the issue. We do not encourage singling out the person, as it may be classified as

harassment, which violates our guidelines.

If you think that there is immediate cause for concern, you can send a report to the Instagram Team.

Please provide all necessary information for us to quickly respond to an issue that urgently needs

our attention, this includes image or video descriptions & dates, URLs, and valid usernames.

If you believe you will have trouble following these guidelines we’d suggest finding an alternative photo sharing

service, as Instagram may not be the best place for you. We value these guidelines, and believe that they will

help keep Instagram a safe & fun place for everyone.

If you need further information, you can check out our Support Center and Terms of Use.

The Instagram Team

ABOUT US

HELP

API

JOBS

BLOG

TERMS

PRIVACY

© 20145 INSTAGRAM, INC.

Community Guidelines

The Short

  1. Post your own photos and videos.

  2. Keep your clothes on.

  3. Be respectful.

  4. Don’t spam.

  5. HAVE FUN!

The Long

The detailed Community Guidelines below have been created in order to help you understand the best

practices as a member of the Instagram community. By utilizing Instagram you are also subject to our Terms

of Use.

What to do:

  1. Do share photos and videos that you’ve taken.

Instagram is a great way to share your life through photos and videos, but we have to ask that you

don’t share photos or videos of someone else’s life. Since people own the rights to all photos or

videos they have uploaded using our service, we ask that you respect their copyright ownership. If

you want to express your excitement over a beautiful photo or video, it’s best to double tap on the

post to like it!

  1. Do share photos and videos that are safe for people of all ages.

Remember that our community is a diverse one, and that your posts are visible to people as young

as 13 years old. While we respect the artistic integrity of photos and videos, we have to keep our

product and the content within it in line with our App Store’s rating for nudity and mature content. In

other words, please do not post nudity or mature content of any kind.

  1. Do treat others as you would like to be treated.

People from around the world with different backgrounds come together to share moments on

Instagram, which is great, but it also means that not everyone will agree with what you think or

believe. We ask that everyone be polite and respectful in their interactions with other members.

  1. Do have meaningful & genuine interactions.

Self-promotion or commercial solicitation of any kind, in any form, is rarely well-received. People

often notice when you have posted the same comment elsewhere or have followed a large number of

accounts to gain followers in return, so please be sincere with your exchanges on Instagram.

  1. Do have fun!

Instagram is the best way to quickly share beautiful photographs and videos of your life with others,

and see the world through others’ eyes.

What not to do:

It is important to note that overstepping the boundaries outlined below may result in a disabled account, or

discontinued access to Instagram, without warning.

  1. Don’t share photos or videos that aren’t yours.

This includes other people’s posts, and/or things that you have copied or collected from the Internet.

Accounts that solely consist of only this type of content may be disabled at any time.

  1. Don’t share photos or videos that show nudity or mature content.

If you wouldn’t show the photo or video you are thinking about uploading to a child, or your boss, or

your parents, you probably shouldn’t share it on Instagram. The same rule applies to your profile

photo. Accounts found sharing nudity or mature content will be disabled and your access to

Instagram may be discontinued. While we know that families use Instagram to capture and share

photos of their children, we may remove images that show nude or partially nude children for safety

reasons. Even when these images are uploaded with the best of intentions, this content could be re-

shared and used by other people in unanticipated and inappropriate ways. You can learn more on

our Tips for Parents page.

  1. Don’t share photos or videos of illegal content.

If you are reported for sharing prohibited or illegal content, including photographs or videos of

Instagram Help Center

Search the Howelp Cecant wer help?

extreme violence or gore, your account may be disabled and we will take appropriate action, which

may include reporting you to the authorities. Additionally, it is neither possible nor permitted to

complete transactions involving regulated goods on our platform. If your photos or videos are

promoting the sale of regulated goods or services, including firearms, alcohol, tobacco, prescription

drugs, or adult products, we expect you to make sure you’re following the law and to encourage

others to do the same.

  1. Don’t spam.

Instagram is a place where people can share beautiful moments from their lives, and when you

engage in self-promotional behavior of any kind on Instagram it makes people who have shared that

moment with you feel sad inside. This guideline includes repetitive comments, as well as service

manipulation in order to self-promote, and extends to commercial spam comments, such as

discount codes or URLs to websites. We ask that you keep your interactions on Instagram

meaningful and genuine.

  1. Don’t be rude.

Instagram is a friendly place where everyone should feel safe and comfortable sharing their lives

through photos and videos. It is not an appropriate place to abuse, attack, harass, or impersonate

others. If we receive valid complaints about your conduct, we’ll send a warning or disable your

account. Alternatively, we’d recommend people block all meanies & trolls to prevent further issues.

  1. Don't promote or glorify self-harm.

While Instagram is a place where people can share their lives with others through photographs and

videos, any account found encouraging or urging users to embrace anorexia, bulimia, or other eating

disorders; or to cut, harm themselves, or commit suicide will result in a disabled account without

warning. We believe that communication regarding these behaviors in order to create awareness,

come together for support and to facilitate recovery is important, but that Instagram is not the place

for active promotion or glorification of self-harm.

Additional things to remember

Instagram is a diverse community, and it is likely that you will come across things that offend you. If

you are offended by a photo or video that may not violate any of the above guidelines, we’d suggest

you navigate away from the account, or even use our blocking feature. If you are unsure about the

content, you can report it utilizing our built-in reporting functionality in order to bring it to the

Instagram Team’s attention.

If you find that one of your posts has been uploaded to another person’s profile, try not to panic. It is

likely a misunderstanding and not ill-intended. A good first step is to comment on the post & politely

ask that they take the content down. If that doesn’t work, please file a DMCA report so that we may

investigate.

You might find yourself wanting to post a screenshot of the offending account to your photo-stream

in order to draw attention to the situation or person, but that’s often not the best way to go about

resolving the issue. We do not encourage singling out the person, as it may be classified as

harassment, which violates our guidelines.

If you think that there is immediate cause for concern, you can send a report to the Instagram Team.

Please provide all necessary information for us to quickly respond to an issue that urgently needs

our attention, this includes image or video descriptions & dates, URLs, and valid usernames.

If you believe you will have trouble following these guidelines we’d suggest finding an alternative photo sharing

service, as Instagram may not be the best place for you. We value these guidelines, and believe that they will

help keep Instagram a safe & fun place for everyone.

If you need further information, you can check out our Support Center and Terms of Use.

The Instagram Team

disorders; or to cut, harm themselves, or commit

warning. We believe that communication regarding these behaviors in order to

for for

blocking feature. If you are unsure about the content, you can report it utilizing our built-in reporting functionality in order to

investigate.

the situation or person, but that’s often not the best way to go about

resolving the issue. We do not encourage singling out the

harassment, which violates our guidelines.

our attention, this includes image or video

descriptions & dates, URLs, and valid usernames.

service, as Instagram may not be the best place for you. We value these guidelines, and believe that they will

help keep Instagram a safe & fun place for everyone.

Community Guidelines

The Short

1.The LPong

Instagram cphommunitos and videos.

Instagram, without warning.

2

Additional things to remember

If you believe you will have trouble following these guidelines we’d suggest finding an alternative photo sharing service, as Instagram may

not be the best place for you. We value these guidelines, and believe that they will help keep Instagram a safe & fun place for everyone.

The Instagram Team

shouldn’t share it on Instagram. The same rule applies to your profile photo. Accounts found sharing nudity or mature content

will be disabled and your access to Instagram may be discontinued. While we know that families use Instagram to capture and

share photos of their children, we may remove images that show nude or partially nude children for safety reasons. Even when

these images are uploaded with the best of intentions, this content could be re-shared and used by other people in

unanticipated and inappropriate ways. You can learn more on our Tips for Parents page.

Don’t share photos or videos of illegal content.

If you are reported for sharing prohibited or illegal content, including photographs or videos of extreme violence or gore, your

account may be disabled and we will take appropriate action, which may include reporting you to the authorities. Additionally, it

is neither possible nor permitted to complete transactions involving regulated goods on our platform. If your photos or videos

are promoting the sale of regulated goods or services, including firearms, alcohol, tobacco, prescription drugs, or adult

products, we expect you to make sure you’re following the law and to encourage others to do the same.

3

Don’t spam.

Instagram is a place where people can share beautiful moments from their lives, and when you engage in self-promotional

behavior of any kind on Instagram it makes people who have shared that moment with you feel sad inside. This guideline

includes repetitive comments, as well as service manipulation in order to self-promote, and extends to commercial spam

comments, such as discount codes or URLs to websites. We ask that you keep your interactions on Instagram meaningful and

gmeanuingful and genuine.

4

5. Don’t be rude.

Instagram is a friendly place where everyone should feel safe and comfortable sharing their lives

through photos and videos. It

is not an appropriate place to abuse, attack, harass, or impersonate

others. If we receive valid complaints about your conduct,

we’ll send a warning or disable your

account. Alternatively, we’d recommend people block all meanies & trolls to prevent further

issues.

5

6. Don't promote or glorify self-harm.

While Instagram is a place where people can share their lives with others through photographs and

videos, any account found

encouraging or urging users to embrace anorexia, bulimia, or other eating

disorders; or to cut, harm themselves, or commit

suicide will result in a disabled account without

warning. We believe that communication regarding these behaviors in order to

create awareness,

come together for support and to facilitate recovery is important, but that Instagram is not the place for

for active promotion or glorification of self-harm.

6Additional things to remember

Instagram is a diverse community, and it is likely that you will come across things that offend you. If

you are offended by a photo

or video that may not violate any of the above guidelines, we’d suggest

you navigate away from the account, or even use our

blocking feature. If you are unsure about the

content, you can report it utilizing our built-in reporting functionality in order to

bring it to the

Instagram Team’s attention.

If you find that one of your posts has been uploaded to another person’s profile, try not to panic. It is

likely a misunderstanding

and not ill-intended. A good first step is to comment on the post & politely

ask that they take the content down. If that doesn’t

work, please file a DMCA report so that we may

investigate.

You might find yourself wanting to post a screenshot of the offending account to your photo-stream in order to draw attention to

in order to draw attention to the situation or person, but that’s often not the best way to go about

resolving the issue. We do not encourage singling out the

person, as it may be classified as

harassment, which violates our guidelines.

If you think that there is immediate cause for concern, you can send a report to the Instagram Team.

Please provide all

necessary information for us to quickly respond to an issue that urgently needs

our attention, this includes image or video

descriptions & dates, URLs, and valid usernames.

If you believe you will have trouble following these guidelines we’d suggest finding an alternative photo sharing

service, as Instagram may not be the best place for you. We value these guidelines, and believe that they will

help keep Instagram a safe & fun place for everyone.

If you need further information, you can check out our Support Center and Terms of Use.

The Instagram Team

API

JOBS

Community Guidelines

The Short

1We want Instagram to continue to be an authentic and safe place for inspiration and expression. Help us foster

this community. Post your ownly yphourtos and videown photos and videos and always follow the law. Respect everyone on

2Instagram, don’t spam people or post nudity.

T Keep your clothes Long

Instagram is a reflection of our diverse community of cultures, ages, and beliefs. We’ve spent a lot of time

3thinking about the different points of view that create a safe and open environment for everyone.

We created the Community Guidelines so you can help us foster and protect this amazing community. By

e respectfusing Instagram, you agree to these guidelines and our Terms of Use. We’re committed to these guidelines

4and we hope you are too. OverDon’t stepping these boundaries may result in a disabled account.

5. HAVE FUN!

The Long

The detailed Community Guidelines below have been created in order to help you understand the best

practices as a member of the Instagram community. By utilizing Instagram you are also subject to our Terms

of Use.

What to do:

  1. SDo share only photos and videos that you’ve taken or have the right to share.

As always, you own the content you post on Instagram. Ris a gremat way to sharemb your life through photos pand videost authentic content, and

don’t post anything you’ve copied or collected from the Internet that you don’t have the right to post.

Learn more abut we have to ask that you

don’t share photos or videos of someonte else’s lifectual property rights. Since people own the rights to all photos or

videos they have uploaded using our service, we ask that you respect their copyright ownership. If

you want to express your excitement over a beautiful photo or video, it’s best to double tap on the

post to like it!

  1. DPo share photos and videos that are safe for pehotple of all ages and videos that are appropriate for a diverse audience.

RWem know that there are times when people might want to share nude images that are artistic or

creative in nature, ber that our community fis a diverse onr a variety of reasons, wand that your posts are vdon’t allow nudity on Instagram. This includes

photos, videos, and some digitally-created content that show sexual intercourse, genitals, and

close-ups of fully-nude ble to people as youttng

as 13 years oldcks. IWhile we respect the alrtistic integrity of photos and vincludes some photos of female nipples, buwe have to photos of post-

mastectomy scarring and women actively breastfeeding are allowed. Nudity in photos of paintings

and sculptures is OK, too.

People likeep our

product and the content within it in line with our App Store’sh rating for nudity and mature cphontos or videnos of their children. FIn

other wosafety rdeasons, please do noth post nudity or maturer content of anyre ktimes when we

may remove images that show nude or partially-nude children. Even when this content is shared

3with good intentions, it could be used by others in unanticipated ways. You can learn more on our

Tips for Parents page.

DFo treat others as you would like to be tr meateningful and genuine interactions.

PHeoplep from arousnd stheay spam-world with differeent by not artificially collecting likgrounds come together to share moments on

Instagram, followhich is greatrs, but it also means that not everyone swill agree with what you think or

bels, posting revpetitive

comments or content, or repeatedly contacting people for commercial purposes without their

consent. We ask that everyone be polite and respectful in their interactions with other members.

4. DFo have meaningfull & genuine interactionsw the law.

Instagram is not a place to support or praise terrorism, organized crime, or hate groups. Offering

sexual services, buying or selling illegal or prescription drugs (even if it’s legal in your region), as

well as promoting recreational drug use is also not allowed. Remember to always follow the law

when offering to sell or buy regulated goods, including firearms, alcohol, and tobacco. You can learn

more on our Regulated Goods and Self-promotion or commercial solicitation of any kind, in any form, is rarely well-receiviceds page. People

Woften notice when you have zposted the same comment elsewhere or have followed a large number of

accounts to gain followers in return, so please be sincere withen ityour comes to sharing sexuchalnges con Instaent involving raminors or threatening to

post intimate images of others.

5. RDo havespect other members of the un!

Instagram is the best way to quickly share beautiful photographs and videos of your life with others,

and see the world through others’ eyes.

What not to do:

It is important to note that overstepping the boundaries outlined below may result in a disabled account, or

discontinued access to Instagram, without warning.

  1. Don’t share photos or videos that aren’t yours.

We want to foster a positive, diverse community. We remove content that contains credible threats

or hate speech, content that targets private individuals to degrade or shame them, personal

information meant to blackmail or harass someone, and repeated unwanted messages. We do

generally allow stronger conversation around people who are featured in the news or have a large

public audience due to their profession or chosen activities.

It's never OK to encourage violence or attack anyone based on their race, ethnicity, national origin,

sex, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, religious affiliation, disabilities, or diseases. When

hate speech is being shared to challenge it or to raise awareness, we may allow it. In those

instances, we ask that you express your intent clearly.

Serious threats of harm to public and personal safety aren't allowed. This includes other people’s posecific threats of

physical harm as well as threats of theft, and/or things that you havae copied or collected from the Interdalism, aned other financial harm.

Accounts Wthat solely consist of only this type of content marefully review

reports of threats and consider many things when determining whether a threat is credibe disabled at any time.

2. MDon’t share photos or videos that show nudity or maiture con our supportive environment by not glorifying self-injury.

The If you wouldn’t show the photo or video you agream thicommunity cares for each other, and is often a place where people facing difficult

issues such as eating disorders, cutting, or other kingds of self-injury come together to create

awareness or find support. We try to do our part bout uploading to a child, or your boss, or

your parents, yovu probably shouldn’t share idit on Instagr education in the app and adding

information in the Help Center so people can get the help they need. The same rule applies to your profile

photo. Accounts found sharing nudity or mature content will be disabled and your access to

Instagram may be discontinued. While we know that families use Instagram to capture and share

photos of their children, we may remove images that show nude or partially nude children for safety

reasons. Even when these images are uploaded with the best of intentions, this content could be re-

shared and used by other people in unanticipated and inappropriate ways. You can learn more on

our Tips for Parents page.

  1. IDonstagram Help Center

How can we help?

Encouraging or urging people to embrace self-injury is counter to this environment of support, and

we’t share photos or videos of illegal rcontenmove it or disable accounts if it’s reported to us. To protect people, we may also remove

content identifying victims or survivors of self-injury if the content targets them for attack or humor.

Be thoughtful when posting newsworthy events.

We understand that many people use If you are reported for sharinstag pram to share important and newsworthy events. Some

of these issues can involve graphic images. Because so many different people and age groups use

Instagram, we may remove videos of intense, graphic violence to make sure Instagram stays

appropriate for everyone.

We understand that people often share this kind of content to condemn or raise awareness. If you

do share content for these reasons, we encourage you to caption your photo with a warning abited our illegal cont

graphic violence. Sharing graphic images for sadistic pleasure or to glorify violence is never allowed.

Help us keep the community strong:

Each of us is an important part of the Instagram community. If you see something that you think

may violate our guidelines, including plhotographs or videoase help us by using ofur built-in reporting option. We have a global

**team that reviews these reports and works as quickly as possible to remove content that doesn’t

meet our guidelines. Even if you or someone you know doesn’t have an Instagram Help Center**

How can we help?

extreme violencce ountr gore, your account mayn

still file a report. When you complete the report, try to provide as much information as possible di,

such as links, usernames, and descriptions of the content, so we can find and review the content

quickly.

You may find content you don’t like, buled and we will t doesn’t violate the community guidelines. If that happens,

you can unfollow or blocke appropriathe actiperson who posted it, which

may include reportifng you to the authoritie's something you don't like in a

comment on one of your posts, you can delete that comment.

M Additionanlly disputes and misunderstandings can be resolved directly between members of the

community. If one of your photos or videos was posted by someone else, yit is neither possible nor permitted to

complete transactions involving regulated gcoods on our plad tfory commenting

on the post and asking the person to take it down. If your photos or videos are

promoting the sale of regulated goods or services, including firearms, alcohol, tobacco, prescription

drugs, or adult products, we expect you to make sure you’re following the law and to encourage

others to do the same.

  1. Don’t spam.

Instagram is a place where people can share beautiful moments from their lives, and when you

engage in self-promotional behavior of any kind on Instagram it makes people who have shared that

moment with you feel sad inside. This guideline includes repetitive comments, as well as service

manipulation in order to self-promote, and extends to commercial spam comments, such as

discount codes or URLs to websites. We ask that you keep your interactions on Instagram

meaningful and genuine.

  1. Don’t be rude.

Instagram is a friendly place where everyone should feel safe and comfortable sharing their lives

through photos and videos. It is not an appropriate place to abuse, attack, hyou carn always file a

copyright report so we can investigate. Or, or impersonate

others. If ywe receive valid coumplaints about your conduct, we’ll send a warning or disable your

account. Alternatively, we’d recommend people block all meanies & trolls to prevent further issues.

  1. Don't promote or glorify self-harm.

While Instagram is a place where people can share their lives with others through photographs and

videos, any account found encouraging or urging users to embrace anorexia, bulimia, or other eating

disorders; or to cut, harm themselves, or commit suicide will result in a disabled account without

warning. We believe that communication regarding these behaviors in order to create awareness,

come together for support and to facilitate recovery is important, but that Instagram is not the place

for active promotion or glorification of self-harm.

Additional things to remember

Instagram is a diverse community, and it is likely that you will come across things that offend you. If

you are offended by a photo or video that may not violate any of the above guidelines, we’d suggest

you navigate away from the account, or even use our blocking feature. If you are unsure about the

content, you can report it utilizing our built-in reporting functionality in order to bring it to the

Instagram Team’s attention.

If you find that one of your posts has been uploaded to another person’s profile, try not to panic. It is

likely a misunderstanding and not ill-intended. A good first step is to comment on the post & politely

ask that they take the content down. If that doesn’t work, pleyou

canse file a trademark report. DMon't target the person who posted it by posting screenshots and

drawing attention to the situation because that may be classified as harassment.

To help keep the community safe, there are times when we work with law enforcement including

when we believe that there’s risk of physical harm or threat to public safety.

For more information, check out our Help CA report so that we may

investiger atnd Terms of Use.

TYou might find yourself wankting to post a screenshot of the offending account to your fphoto-stream

in order to draw attention to thel situation or piersong us create one of the best communities in the world, but that’s often not the best way to go about

resolving the issue. We do not encourage singling out the person, as it may be classified as

harassment, which violates our guidelines.

If you think that there is immediate cause for concern, you can send a report to the Instagram Team.

Please provide all necessary information for us to quickly respond to an issue that urgently needs

our attention, this includes image or video descriptions & dates, URLs, and valid usernames.

If you believe you will have trouble following these guidelines we’d suggest finding an alternative photo sharing

service, as Instagram may not be the best place for you. We value these guidelines, and believe that they will

help keep Instagram a safe & fun place for everyone.

If you need further information, you can check out our Support Center and Terms of Use.

The Instagram Team

The Short

We want Instagram to continue to be an authentic and safe place for inspiration and expression. Help us foster this community. Post only

your own photos and videos and always follow the law. Respect everyone on Instagram, don’t spam people or post nudity.

The Long

Instagram is a reflection of our diverse community of cultures, ages, and beliefs. We’ve spent a lot of time thinking about the different

points of view that create a safe and open environment for everyone.

We created the Community Guidelines so you can help us foster and protect this amazing community. By using Instagram, you agree to

these guidelines and our Terms of Use. We’re committed to these guidelines and we hope you are too. Overstepping these boundaries

may result in a disabled account.

Ask a question

Community Guidelines

The Short

We want Instagram to continue to be an authentic and safe place for inspiration and expression. Help us foster

this community. Post only your own photos and videos and always follow the law. Respect everyone on

Instagram, don’t spam people or post nudity.

The Long

Instagram is a reflection of our diverse community of cultures, ages, and beliefs. We’ve spent a lot of time

thinking about the different points of view that create a safe and open environment for everyone.

We created the Community Guidelines so you can help us foster and protect this amazing community. By

using Instagram, you agree to these guidelines and our Terms of Use. We’re committed to these guidelines

and we hope you are too. Overstepping these boundaries may result in a disabled account.

Share only photos and videos that you’ve taken or have the right to share.

As always, you own the content you post on Instagram. Remember to post authentic content, and

don’t post anything you’ve

copied or collected from the Internet that you don’t have the right to post.

Learn more about intellectual property rights.

Post photos and videos that are appropriate for a diverse audience.

We know that there are times when people might want to share nude images that are artistic or

creative in nature, but for a

variety of reasons, we don’t allow nudity on Instagram. This includes

photos, videos, and some digitally-created content that

show sexual intercourse, genitals, and

close-ups of fully-nude buttocks. It also includes some photos of female nipples, but

photos of post-

mastectomy scarring and women actively breastfeeding are allowed. Nudity in photos of paintings

and and

sculptures is OK, too.

People like to share photos or videos of their children. For safety reasons, there are times when we

may remove imayges thatremove images that

show nude or partially-nude children. Even when this content is shared

with good intentions, it could be used by others in

unanticipated ways. You can learn more on our

Tips for Parents page.

Foster meaningful and genuine interactions.

Help us stay spam-free by not artificially collecting likes, followers, or shares, posting repetitive

comments or content, or repeatedly contacting people for commercial purposes without their

repeatedly contacting people for commercial purposes without their consent.

Follow the law.

Instagram is not a place to support or praise terrorism, organized crime, or hate groups. Offering

sexual services, buying or

selling illegal or prescription drugs (even if it’s legal in your region), as

well was promoting recreational drug use is also asnot promoting recreational drug use is also not

allowed. Remember to always follow the law

when offering to sell or buy regulated goods, including firearms, alcohol, and

tobacco. You can learn

more on our Regulated Goods and Services page.

We have zero tolerance when it comes to sharing sexual content involving minors or threatening to

post pintimate images ofst intimate images of

others.

Respect other members of the Instagram community.

We want to foster a positive, diverse community. We remove content that contains credible threats

or hate speech, content that

targets private individuals to degrade or shame them, personal

information meant to blackmail or harass someone, and

repeated unwanted messages. We do

generally allow stronger conversation around people who are featured in the news or have a ly allow stronger conversation around people who are featured in the news or

have a large public audience due to their profession or chosen activities.

It's never OK to encourage violence or attack anyone based on their race, ethnicity, national origin,

sex, gender, gender

identity, sexual orientation, religious affiliation, disabilities, or diseases. When

hate speech is being shared to challenge it or to

raise awareness, we may allow it. In those

instances, we ask that you express your intent clearly.

Help us keep the community strong:

For more information, check out our Help Center and Terms of Use.

Thank you for helping us create one of the best communities in the world,

The Instagram Team

Serious threats of harm to public and personal safety aren't allowed. This includes specific threats of

physical phyarm asic well asl harm as well as

threats of theft, vandalism, and other financial harm. We carefully review

reports of threpats and consider many things ofwhen threats and consider many things when

determining whether a threat is credible.

Maintain our supportive environment by not glorifying self-injury.

The Instagram community cares for each other, and is often a place where people facing difficult

issues such as eatingssues such as eating

disorders, cutting, or other kinds of self-injury come together to create

awareness or find support. We try to do our part by providing education in the app and adding

providing education in the app and adding information in the Help Center so people can get the help they need.

Instagram Help Center

How can we help?

Encouraging or urging people to embrace self-injury is counter to this environment of support, and

we’ll remove it or disable

accounts if it’s reported to us. To protect people, we may also remove

content identifying victims or survivors of self-injury if the

content targets them for attack or humor.

Be thoughtful when posting newsworthy events.

We understand that many people use Instagram to share important and newsworthy events. Some

of these issues can invoflve these issues can involve

graphic images. Because so many different people and age groups use

Instagram, we may remove videos of intense, graphic

violence to make sure Instagram stays

appropriate for everyone.

We understand that people often share this kind of content to condemn or raise awareness. If you

do dshare content for theshare content for these

reasons, we encourage you to caption your photo with a warning about

graphic violence. Sharing graphic images for sadistic

pleasure or to glorify violence is never allowed.

please help us by using our built-in reporting option. We have a global team that reviews these reports and works as quickly as

possible to remove content that doesn’t meet our guidelines. Evach of us is an important part of then if you or someone you know doesn’t have an Instagram

accommunit, you can still file a report. When you complete the report, try to provide as much information as possible, such as links,

usernames, and descriptions of the content, so we can find and review the content quickly.

may violathe

team that reviews these repomerts and wone else, you could try commenting on the post and asks as quicng the person to takly as possible to remove content that doesn’t

meet our guit dowelines. Even if you or someone you know doesn’t have an Instagram account, you can

still file a report. When you complete the report, try to provide as much information as possible,

such as links, usernames, and descriptions of the content, so we can find and review the content

quickly.

You may find content you don’t like, but doesn’t violate the community guidelines. If that happens,

you can unfollow or block the person who posted it, and if there's something you don't like in a

comment on one of your posts, you can delete that comment.

Many disputes and misunderstandings can be resolved directly between members of the

community. If one of your photos or videos was posted by someone else, you could try commenting

on the post and asking the person to take it down. If that doesn’t work, you can always file a

copyright report so we can investigate. Or, if you believe someone is violating your

trademark, you

can file a trademark report. Don't target the person who posted it by posting screenshots and

drawing drawttentiong attention

to the situation because that may be classified as harassment.

To help keep the community safe, there are times when we work with law enforcement including

when we believe that there’s

risk of physical harm or threat to public safety.

For more information, check out our Help Center and Terms of Use.

Thank you for helping us create one of the best communities in the world,

The Instagram Team

Community Guidelines

The Short

We want Instagram to continue to be an authentic and safe place for inspiration and expression. Help us foster

this community. Post only your own photos and videos and always follow the law. Respect everyone on

Instagram, don’t spam people or post nudity.

The Long

Instagram is a reflection of our diverse community of cultures, ages, and beliefs. We’ve spent a lot of time

thinking about the different points of view that create a safe and open environment for everyone.

We created the Community Guidelines so you can help us foster and protect this amazing community. By

using Instagram, you agree to these guidelines and our Terms of Use. We’re committed to these guidelines

and we hope you are too. Overstepping these boundaries may result in a disabled account.

Share only photos and videos that you’ve taken or have the right to share.

As always, you own the content you post on Instagram. Remember to post authentic content, and

don’t post anything you’ve

copied or collected from the Internet that you don’t have the right to post.

Learn more about intellectual property rights.

We know that there are times when people might want to share nude images that are artistic or

creative in nature, but for a

variety of reasons, we don’t allow nudity on Instagram. This includes

photos, videos, and some digitally-created content that

show sexual intercourse, genitals, and

close-ups of fully-nude buttocks. It also includes some photos of female nipples, but

photos of post-

mastectomy scarring and women actively breastfeeding are allowed. Nudity in photos of paintings and

and sculptures is OK, too.

People like to share photos or videos of their children. For safety reasons, there are times when we may remove images that

may remove images that show nude or partially-nude children. Even when this content is shared

with good intentions, it could be used by others in

unanticipated ways. You can learn more on our

Tips for Parents page.

comments or content, or

repeatedly contacting people for commercial purposeas without theirdly contacting people for commercial purposes without their

consent.

sexual services, buying or

selling illegal or prescription drugs (even if it’s legal in your region), as well as promoting recreational drug use is also not

well as promoting recreational drug use is also not allowed. Remember to always follow the law

when offering to sell or buy regulated goods, including firearms, alcohol, and

tobacco. You can learn

more on our Regulated Goods and Services page.

We have zero tolerance when it comes to sharing sexual content involving minors or threatening to post intimate images of

post intimate images of others.

or hate speech, content that

targets private individuals to degrade or shame them, personal

repeated unwanted messages. We do generally allow stronger conversation around people who are featured in the news or

have a largenerally allow stronger conversation around people who are featured in the news or have a large

public audience due to their profession or chosen activities.

It's never OK to encourage violence or attack anyone based on their race, ethnicity, national origin,

sex, gender, gender

identity, sexual orientation, religious affiliation, disabilities, or diseases. When

hate speech is being shared to challenge it or to

raise awareness, we may allow it. In those

The Instagram Team

Serious threats of harm to public and personal safety aren't allowed. This includes specific threats of physical harm as well as

threats of theft, vandalism, and other financial harm. We carefully review reports of threats and consider many things when

reports of threats and consider many things when determining whether a threat is credible.

Maintain our supportive environment by not glorifying self-injury.

The Instagram community cares for each other, and is often a place where people facing difficult issues such as eating

issues such as eating disorders, cutting, or other kinds of self-injury come together to create

awareness or find support. We try to do our part by

providing education in the aprovp and addiding education in the app and adding

information in the Help Center so people can get the help they need.

Instagram Help Center

How can we help?

Encouraging or urging people to embrace self-injury is counter to this environment of support, and

we’ll remove it or disable

accounts if it’s reported to us. To protect people, we may also remove

content identifying victims or survivors of self-injury if the

content targets them for attack or humor.

Be thoughtful when posting newsworthy events.

We understand that many people use Instagram to share important and newsworthy events. Some of these issues can involve

of these issues can involve graphic images. Because so many different people and age groups use

Instagram, we may remove videos of intense, graphic

violence to make sure Instagram stays

appropriate for everyone.

We understand that people often share this kind of content to condemn or raise awareness. If you do share content for these

do share content for these reasons, we encourage you to caption your photo with a warning about

graphic violence. Sharing graphic images for sadistic

pleasure or to glorify violence is never allowed.

Help us keep the community strong:

Each of us is an important part of the Instagram community. If you see something that you think

may violate our guidelines,

please help us by using our built-in reporting option. We have a global

team that reviews these reports and works as quickly as

possible to remove content that doesn’t

meet our guidelines. Even if you or someone you know doesn’t have an Instagram

account, you can

still file a report. When you complete the report, try to provide as much information as possible,

such as links,

usernames, and descriptions of the content, so we can find and review the content

quickly.

You may find content you don’t like, but doesn’t violate the community guidelines. If that happens,

you can unfollow or block the

person who posted it, and if there's something you don't like in a

comment on one of your posts, you can delete that comment.

Many disputes and misunderstandings can be resolved directly between members of the

community. If one of your photos or

videos was posted by someone else, you could try commenting

on the post and asking the person to take it down. If that

doesn’t work, you can always file a

copyright report so we can investigate. Or, if you believe someone is violating your

trademark, you

can file a trademark report. Don't target the person who posted it by posting screenshots and drawing attention

drawing attention to the situation because that may be classified as harassment.

To help keep the community safe, there are times when we work with law enforcement including

when we believe that there’s

risk of physical harm or threat to public safety.

For more information, check out our Help Center and Terms of Use.

Thank you for helping us create one of the best communities in the world,

The Instagram Team

ABOUT US

HELP

API

JOBS

BLOG

TERMS

PRIVACY

© 2015 INSTAGRAM, INC.

20150929213454_vs_20151008161054

Community Guidelines

The Short

We want Instagram to continue to be an authentic and safe place for inspiration and expression. Help us foster

this community. Post only your own photos and videos and always follow the law. Respect everyone on

Instagram, don’t spam people or post nudity.

The Long

Instagram is a reflection of our diverse community of cultures, ages, and beliefs. We’ve spent a lot of time

thinking about the different points of view that create a safe and open environment for everyone.

We created the Community Guidelines so you can help us foster and protect this amazing community. By

using Instagram, you agree to these guidelines and our Terms of Use. We’re committed to these guidelines

and we hope you are too. Overstepping these boundaries may result in a disabled account.

Share only photos and videos that you’ve taken or have the right to share.

As always, you own the content you post on Instagram. Remember to post authentic content, and

don’t post anything you’ve copied or collected from the Internet that you don’t have the right to post.

Learn more about intellectual property rights.

Post photos and videos that are appropriate for a diverse audience.

We know that there are times when people might want to share nude images that are artistic or

creative in nature, but for a variety of reasons, we don’t allow nudity on Instagram. This includes

photos, videos, and some digitally-created content that show sexual intercourse, genitals, and

close-ups of fully-nude buttocks. It also includes some photos of female nipples, but photos of post-

mastectomy scarring and women actively breastfeeding are allowed. Nudity in photos of paintings

and sculptures is OK, too.

People like to share photos or videos of their children. For safety reasons, there are times when we

may remove images that show nude or partially-nude children. Even when this content is shared

with good intentions, it could be used by others in unanticipated ways. You can learn more on our

Tips for Parents page.

Foster meaningful and genuine interactions.

Help us stay spam-free by not artificially collecting likes, followers, or shares, posting repetitive

comments or content, or repeatedly contacting people for commercial purposes without their

consent.

Follow the law.

Instagram is not a place to support or praise terrorism, organized crime, or hate groups. Offering

sexual services, buying or selling illegal or prescription drugs (even if it’s legal in your region), as

well as promoting recreational drug use is also not allowed. Remember to always follow the law

when offering to sell or buy regulated goods, including firearms, alcohol, and tobacco. You can learn

more on our Regulated Goods and Services page. Accounts promoting online gambling, online real

money games of skill or online lotteries must get our prior written permission before using any of our

products.

We have zero tolerance when it comes to sharing sexual content involving minors or threatening to

post intimate images of others.

Respect other members of the Instagram community.

We want to foster a positive, diverse community. We remove content that contains credible threats

or hate speech, content that targets private individuals to degrade or shame them, personal

information meant to blackmail or harass someone, and repeated unwanted messages. We do

generally allow stronger conversation around people who are featured in the news or have a large

public audience due to their profession or chosen activities.

It's never OK to encourage violence or attack anyone based on their race, ethnicity, national origin,

sex, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, religious affiliation, disabilities, or diseases. When

hate speech is being shared to challenge it or to raise awareness, we may allow it. In those

instances, we ask that you express your intent clearly.

Serious threats of harm to public and personal safety aren't allowed. This includes specific threats of

physical harm as well as threats of theft, vandalism, and other financial harm. We carefully review

reports of threats and consider many things when determining whether a threat is credible.

Maintain our supportive environment by not glorifying self-injury.

The Instagram community cares for each other, and is often a place where people facing difficult

issues such as eating disorders, cutting, or other kinds of self-injury come together to create

awareness or find support. We try to do our part by providing education in the app and adding

information in the Help Center so people can get the help they need.

Instagram Help Center

How can we help?

awareness or find support. We try to do our part by providing education in the app and adding

information in the Help Center so people can get the help they need.

Encouraging or urging people to embrace self-injury is counter to this environment of support, and

we’ll remove it or disable accounts if it’s reported to us. To protect people, we may also remove

content identifying victims or survivors of self-injury if the content targets them for attack or humor.

Be thoughtful when posting newsworthy events.

We understand that many people use Instagram to share important and newsworthy events. Some

of these issues can involve graphic images. Because so many different people and age groups use

Instagram, we may remove videos of intense, graphic violence to make sure Instagram stays

appropriate for everyone.

We understand that people often share this kind of content to condemn or raise awareness. If you

do share content for these reasons, we encourage you to caption your photo with a warning about

graphic violence. Sharing graphic images for sadistic pleasure or to glorify violence is never allowed.

Help us keep the community strong:

Each of us is an important part of the Instagram community. If you see something that you think

may violate our guidelines, please help us by using our built-in reporting option. We have a global

team that reviews these reports and works as quickly as possible to remove content that doesn’t

meet our guidelines. Even if you or someone you know doesn’t have an Instagram account, you can

still file a report. When you complete the report, try to provide as much information as possible,

such as links, usernames, and descriptions of the content, so we can find and review the content

quickly.

You may find content you don’t like, but doesn’t violate the community guidelines. If that happens,

you can unfollow or block the person who posted it, and if there's something you don't like in a

comment on one of your posts, you can delete that comment.

Many disputes and misunderstandings can be resolved directly between members of the

community. If one of your photos or videos was posted by someone else, you could try commenting

on the post and asking the person to take it down. If that doesn’t work, you can always file a

copyright report so we can investigate. Or, if you believe someone is violating your trademark, you

can file a trademark report. Don't target the person who posted it by posting screenshots and

drawing attention to the situation because that may be classified as harassment.

To help keep the community safe, there are times when we work with law enforcement including

when we believe that there’s risk of physical harm or threat to public safety.

For more information, check out our Help Center and Terms of Use.

Thank you for helping us create one of the best communities in the world,

The Instagram Team

ABOUT US

JOBS

BLOG

TERMS

PRIVACY

Community Guidelines

The Short

We want Instagram to continue to be an authentic and safe place for inspiration and expression. Help us foster

this community. Post only your own photos and videos and always follow the law. Respect everyone on

Instagram, don’t spam people or post nudity.

The Long

Instagram is a reflection of our diverse community of cultures, ages, and beliefs. We’ve spent a lot of time

thinking about the different points of view that create a safe and open environment for everyone.

We created the Community Guidelines so you can help us foster and protect this amazing community. By

using Instagram, you agree to these guidelines and our Terms of Use. We’re committed to these guidelines

and we hope you are too. Overstepping these boundaries may result in a disabled account.

Share only photos and videos that you’ve taken or have the right to share.

As always, you own the content you post on Instagram. Remember to post authentic content, and

don’t post anything you’ve copied or collected from the Internet that you don’t have the right to post.

Learn more about intellectual property rights.

Post photos and videos that are appropriate for a diverse audience.

and sculptures is OK, too.

with good intentions, it could be used by others in unanticipated ways. You can learn more on our

Tips for Parents page.

comments or content, or repeatedly contacting people for commercial purposes without their

consent.

Follow the law.

sexual services, buying or selling illegal or prescription drugs (even if it’s legal in your region), as

well as promoting recreational drug use is also not allowed. Remember to always follow the law

more on our Regulated Goods and Services page. Accounts promoting online gambling, online real

generally allow stronger conversation around people who are featured in the news or have a large

public audience due to their profession or chosen activities.

sex, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, religious affiliation, disabilities, or diseases. When

hate speech is being shared to challenge it or to raise awareness, we may allow it. In those

instances, we ask that you express your intent clearly.

Serious threats of harm to public and personal safety aren't allowed. This includes specific threats of

physical harm as well as threats of theft, vandalism, and other financial harm. We carefully review

reports of threats and consider many things when determining whether a threat is credible.

Maintain our supportive environment by not glorifying self-injury.

The Instagram community cares for each other, and is often a place where people facing difficult

issues such as eating disorders, cutting, or other kinds of self-injury come together to create

Instagram Help Center

How can we help?

awareness or find support. We try to do our part by providing education in the app and adding

information in the Help Center so people can get the help they need.

Encouraging or urging people to embrace self-injury is counter to this environment of support, and

we’ll remove it or disable accounts if it’s reported to us. To protect people, we may also remove

content identifying victims or survivors of self-injury if the content targets them for attack or humor.

appropriate for everyone.

We understand that people often share this kind of content to condemn or raise awareness. If you

do share content for these reasons, we encourage you to caption your photo with a warning about

graphic violence. Sharing graphic images for sadistic pleasure or to glorify violence is never allowed.

Help us keep the community strong:

Each of us is an important part of the Instagram community. If you see something that you think

may violate our guidelines, please help us by using our built-in reporting option. We have a global

team that reviews these reports and works as quickly as possible to remove content that doesn’t

meet our guidelines. Even if you or someone you know doesn’t have an Instagram account, you can

still file a report. When you complete the report, try to provide as much information as possible,

such as links, usernames, and descriptions of the content, so we can find and review the content

quickly.

You may find content you don’t like, but doesn’t violate the community guidelines. If that happens,

you can unfollow or block the person who posted it, and if there's something you don't like in a

comment on one of your posts, you can delete that comment.

Many disputes and misunderstandings can be resolved directly between members of the

community. If one of your photos or videos was posted by someone else, you could try commenting

on the post and asking the person to take it down. If that doesn’t work, you can always file a

copyright report so we can investigate. Or, if you believe someone is violating your trademark, you

can file a trademark report. Don't target the person who posted it by posting screenshots and

drawing attention to the situation because that may be classified as harassment.

To help keep the community safe, there are times when we work with law enforcement including

when we believe that there’s risk of physical harm or threat to public safety.

For more information, check out our Help Center and Terms of Use.

Thank you for helping us create one of the best communities in the world,

Community Guidelines

The Short

We want Instagram to continue to be an authentic and safe place for inspiration and expression. Help us foster

this community. Post only your own photos and videos and always follow the law. Respect everyone on

Instagram, don’t spam people or post nudity.

The Long

Instagram is a reflection of our diverse community of cultures, ages, and beliefs. We’ve spent a lot of time

thinking about the different points of view that create a safe and open environment for everyone.

We created the Community Guidelines so you can help us foster and protect this amazing community. By

using Instagram, you agree to these guidelines and our Terms of Use. We’re committed to these guidelines

and we hope you are too. Overstepping these boundaries may result in a disabled account.

Share only photos and videos that you’ve taken or have the right to share.

As always, you own the content you post on Instagram. Remember to post authentic content, and

don’t post anything you’ve copied or collected from the Internet that you don’t have the right to post.

Learn more about intellectual property rights.

Post photos and videos that are appropriate for a diverse audience.

We know that there are times when people might want to share nude images that are artistic or

creative in nature, but for a variety of reasons, we don’t allow nudity on Instagram. This includes

and sculptures is OK, too.

People like to share photos or videos of their children. For safety reasons, there are times when we

may remove images that show nude or partially-nude children. Even when this content is shared

with good intentions, it could be used by others in unanticipated ways. You can learn more on our

Tips for Parents page.

Help us stay spam-free by not artificially collecting likes, followers, or shares, posting repetitive

comments or content, or repeatedly contacting people for commercial purposes without their

consent.

Follow the law.

sexual services, buying or selling illegal or prescription drugs (even if it’s legal in your region), as

well as promoting recreational drug use is also not allowed. Remember to always follow the law

money games of skill or online lotteries must get our prior written permission before using any of our

post intimate images of others.

or hate speech, content that targets private individuals to degrade or shame them, personal

information meant to blackmail or harass someone, and repeated unwanted messages. We do

generally allow stronger conversation around people who are featured in the news or have a large

public audience due to their profession or chosen activities.

sex, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, religious affiliation, disabilities, or diseases. When

hate speech is being shared to challenge it or to raise awareness, we may allow it. In those

instances, we ask that you express your intent clearly.

Serious threats of harm to public and personal safety aren't allowed. This includes specific threats of

physical harm as well as threats of theft, vandalism, and other financial harm. We carefully review

reports of threats and consider many things when determining whether a threat is credible.

Maintain our supportive environment by not glorifying self-injury.

The Instagram community cares for each other, and is often a place where people facing difficult

issues such as eating disorders, cutting, or other kinds of self-injury come together to create

Instagram Help Center

How can we help?

awareness or find support. We try to do our part by providing education in the app and adding

information in the Help Center so people can get the help they need.

Encouraging or urging people to embrace self-injury is counter to this environment of support, and

we’ll remove it or disable accounts if it’s reported to us. To protect people, we may also remove

content identifying victims or survivors of self-injury if the content targets them for attack or humor.

We understand that many people use Instagram to share important and newsworthy events. Some

of these issues can involve graphic images. Because so many different people and age groups use

Instagram, we may remove videos of intense, graphic violence to make sure Instagram stays

appropriate for everyone.

We understand that people often share this kind of content to condemn or raise awareness. If you

do share content for these reasons, we encourage you to caption your photo with a warning about

graphic violence. Sharing graphic images for sadistic pleasure or to glorify violence is never allowed.

Help us keep the community strong:

Each of us is an important part of the Instagram community. If you see something that you think

may violate our guidelines, please help us by using our built-in reporting option. We have a global

team that reviews these reports and works as quickly as possible to remove content that doesn’t

meet our guidelines. Even if you or someone you know doesn’t have an Instagram account, you can

still file a report. When you complete the report, try to provide as much information as possible,

such as links, usernames, and descriptions of the content, so we can find and review the content

quickly.

You may find content you don’t like, but doesn’t violate the community guidelines. If that happens,

you can unfollow or block the person who posted it, and if there's something you don't like in a

comment on one of your posts, you can delete that comment.

community. If one of your photos or videos was posted by someone else, you could try commenting

on the post and asking the person to take it down. If that doesn’t work, you can always file a

copyright report so we can investigate. Or, if you believe someone is violating your trademark, you

can file a trademark report. Don't target the person who posted it by posting screenshots and

drawing attention to the situation because that may be classified as harassment.

To help keep the community safe, there are times when we work with law enforcement including

when we believe that there’s risk of physical harm or threat to public safety.

For more information, check out our Help Center and Terms of Use.

Community Guidelines

The Short

We want Instagram to continue to be an authentic and safe place for inspiration and expression. Help us foster

this community. Post only your own photos and videos and always follow the law. Respect everyone on

Instagram, don’t spam people or post nudity.

The Long

Instagram is a reflection of our diverse community of cultures, ages, and beliefs. We’ve spent a lot of time

thinking about the different points of view that create a safe and open environment for everyone.

We created the Community Guidelines so you can help us foster and protect this amazing community. By

using Instagram, you agree to these guidelines and our Terms of Use. We’re committed to these guidelines

and we hope you are too. Overstepping these boundaries may result in adeleted content, disabled accounts, or

other restrictions.

Share only photos and videos that you’ve taken or have the right to share.

As always, you own the content you post on Instagram. Remember to post authentic content, and

don’t post anything you’ve copied or collected from the Internet that you don’t have the right to post.

Learn more about intellectual property rights.

Post photos and videos that are appropriate for a diverse audience.

and sculptures is OK, too.

post intimate images of others.

warning about

never allowed.

may violate our guidelines, please help us by using our built-in reporting option. We have a global

such as links, usernames, and descriptions of the content, so we can find and review ithe content

quickly. We

may remove entire posts if either the imagery or associated captions violate our guidelines.
